title: Can someone check my web history if I use their wifi theough my phone? - Quora

response.answer_text: They can but they would have to have logging turned enabled on a device that supports it. Your average home wireless router doesn’t. But WiFi provided by a business or enterprise surly logs activity though most businesses only inspect these logs if there is an issue reported. Not to mention that the few home routers that can log web activity generally can’t tell who is using what device or grab the actual page content of the sites. They can maybe log the URL but its not like they are going to be able to nab your login info.

They can’t view your history but can monitor the sites that you visit by using WiFi Sniffer software like Wireshark . Such software can capture packets of data that are transmitted from the WiFi router to your device. Any person with credentials to the router can view or analyze the data packets and extract sensitive information.

Yes it is possible, however highly unlikely. They would need time and very high technical skills. Keep your phone updated and clear your search history if worried. Use your own wifi for financial stuff like banking etc. Its good to have a firewall app and software such as malwarebytes.
